Release Notes:

Glasvegas kick off 2009 with their superb Flowers & Football
Tops single, due out end of Feb 2009!

Formed by Scottish cousins James and Rab Allan (vocals and
guitars, respectively), Glasvegas deftly fuses a 1950s/early
`60s rock & roll vibe with a swirling shoegazer-inspired
atmosphere. Kindred spirits to acts such as the Raveonettes
and Black Rebel Motorcycle Club, the group has a more
straightforward sound than those artists, allowing the
emotive, heavily accented singing of James Allan to shine
through. In late 2007, the Glaswegian band gained significant
attention, particularly in the U.K., thanks in large part to
ardent supporter Alan McGee, former head of Creation Records.
This buzz led to the ensemble signing with the Columbia label,
and unveiling its self-titled album to considerable accolades.
